timeline.bodyText:
In for a penny, in for a pound.  I think the following would simplify navigation even more:

Turn _index.md into a sparse contents, similar to the pattern used for other multi-page discussions in our doc (for example, see the model-in-image user doc).
Put the fodder presently in _index.md into a new file "overview.md", and title/reference as "overview".
Move 'References' out of Cleanup - just put it at the end of "overview.md".

replies.bodyText: @tbarnes-us I'm going to stand my ground on this one, and here's why. Yes, I'm familiar with the style we used for the MII user guide docs (and others) but don't find it appropriate here. The introductory document in the sample provides adequate TOC and navigation for all the other sections. Adding an index page with a one line description of the other docs (which are self-explanatory, such as prerequisites, initial use case, update 1, etc.) adds only more clicks for the user to get where they're going. Considering that this sample already has seven docs associated with it, I don't think that we need to add more. Of course, however, I am open minded to hear other opinions. Last, I will concede to your idea of putting the References at the end of the first document; they got lost and were less useful after the Cleanup.
